Class MultiDS<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • MultiDS<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrimQ<T>, Reorder

    public class MultiDS<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PrimQ<T>, Reorder
    MultiDS is a multiple-type data structure with a few built-in management methods

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiDS()
      Constructors
      MultiDS(int size) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addItem(T item)
      Add a new Object to the PrimQ in the next available location.
      T bottom()
      Returns the most recent item in the PrimQ.
      void clear()
      Reset the PrimQ to empty status by reinitializing the variables appropriately
      boolean empty()
      Return true if the PrimQ is empty, and false otherwise
      boolean full()
      Return true if the PrimQ is full, and false otherwise
      T removeItem()
      Remove and return the "oldest" item in the PrimQ.
      void reverse()
      methods required by the Reorder interface Logically reverse the data in the Reorder object so that the item that was logically first will now be logically last and vice versa.
      void shiftLeft()
      Remove the logical first item of the DS and put it at the end.
      void shiftRight()
      Remove the logical last item of the DS and put it at the front.
      void shuffle()
      Reorganize the items in the object in a pseudo-random way.
      int size()
      Return the number of items currently in the PrimQ
      T top()
      Returns the "oldest" item in the PrimQ.
      java.lang.String toString()

      • MultiDS

        public MultiDS()
        Constructors
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the MultiDS. Default is 10

      • MultiDS

        public MultiDS(int size)

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public boolean addItem(T item)
        Add a new Object to the PrimQ in the next available location. If all goes well, return true. If there is no room in the PrimQ for the new item, return false (you should NOT resize it)
        Specified by:
        addItem in interface PrimQ<T>
        Parameters:
        item - Item to be added. must be same type as MultiDS.

      • removeItem

        public T removeItem()
        Remove and return the "oldest" item in the PrimQ. If the PrimQ is empty, return null.
        Specified by:
        removeItem in interface PrimQ<T>

      • top

        public T top()
        Returns the "oldest" item in the PrimQ. If the PrimQ is empty, return null.
        Specified by:
        top in interface PrimQ<T>

      • bottom

        public T bottom()
        Returns the most recent item in the PrimQ. If the PrimQ is empty, return null.

      • full

        public boolean full()
        Return true if the PrimQ is full, and false otherwise
        Specified by:
        full in interface PrimQ<T>

      • empty

        public boolean empty()
        Return true if the PrimQ is empty, and false otherwise
        Specified by:
        empty in interface PrimQ<T>

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the number of items currently in the PrimQ
        Specified by:
        size in interface PrimQ<T>

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Reset the PrimQ to empty status by reinitializing the variables appropriately
        Specified by:
        clear in interface PrimQ<T>

      • reverse

        public void reverse()
        methods required by the Reorder interface Logically reverse the data in the Reorder object so that the item that was logically first will now be logically last and vice versa. The physical implementation of this can be done in many different ways, depending upon how you actually implemented your physical MultiDS class
        Specified by:
        reverse in interface Reorder

      • shiftRight

        public void shiftRight()
        Remove the logical last item of the DS and put it at the front. As with reverse(), this can be done physically in different ways depending on the underlying implementation.
        Specified by:
        shiftRight in interface Reorder

      • shiftLeft

        public void shiftLeft()
        Remove the logical first item of the DS and put it at the end. As above, this can be done in different ways.
        Specified by:
        shiftLeft in interface Reorder

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Reorganize the items in the object in a pseudo-random way. The exact way is up to you but it should utilize a Random object (see Random in the Java API). Thus, after this operation the "oldest" item in the DS could be arbitrary.
        Specified by:
        shuffle in interface Reorder

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
